TopicTitle: [1.5.x] Asclepius - A Kopernicus planet - SSTO playground

Articles.Content:
> 
> Awesome pics. [Don't forget to give the moon a try!](http://i.imgur.com/azxdCTE.png) Thanks for sharing! If you can get the cloud layers working I'd strongly consider adding them in.

I'll have a try at adding some surface dust to Kruel. First, I have to learn how to add brand new clouds though, up to this point I've only been modifying them. Geologically speaking, how do you imagine the mun be formed and made of?

> 
> Awesome! Thanks! Is there a list of used planet ID (flightGlobalsIndex) numbers compiled anywhere? Something like that would be cool to add to your site to help future planet modders avoid compatibility issues. I used 38, and 39.

As far as I know, it works fine with Outer planets and Sigma mod expansion, as it's the setup I'm running with myself

> 
> I'll have a try at adding some surface dust to Kruel. First, I have to learn how to add brand new clouds though, up to this point I've only been modifying them. Geologically speaking, how do you imagine the mun be formed and made of?
> As far as I know, it works fine with Outer planets and Sigma mod expansion, as it's the setup I'm running with myself

Wonderful! Have you considered contributing to KG2? I would like to see some of your skills put into it:

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125078](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125078)

- - - Updated - - -

He DOES say he is looking for more plernets.....:-)

Pretty nice.

Just wondering, how is the name Asclepius pronounced?

> 
> Wonderful! Have you considered contributing to [KerbalGalaxy 2](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/125078)? I would like to see some of your skills put into it:
> He DOES say he is looking for more plernets.....:-)

I'm no pro by any means ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif) but I'll take a look at it, and make a contribution if I can... A Galaxy Addon is super overwhelming to me. My old computer is lucky to do 1 planet system at a time ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-18T04:36:56Z" title="07/18/2015 04:36  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 18, 2015</time> by MrChumley**

Love the planet. Only done a probe flyby so far but I plan to send a plane over.when I play tomorrow.

Kruel is somewhat uninteresting in comparison, but that's not really a bad thing.

I have no suggestions for improvements that aren't something ridiculous like an orbiting primordial black hole to pull crazy gravity assists off or something.

I'm not even sure if ksp could handle a body with an event horizon, you would probably just go too fast and fly clear through it

> 
> [\[uh-**sklee**-pee-uh s\]](http://static.sfdict.com/staticrep/dictaudio/A07/A0726000.mp3)

Update 7-22-15

**Changes**

- Updated to latest Kopernicus version.
- Added terrain scatter
- Now includes support for [Contract Configurator](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101604) Adds "easter egg contract" [Direct D/L](https://github.com/jrossignol/ContractConfigurator/releases/latest)

(download link in OP updated)

This looks awesome, have rep+.

Downloading in the morning. Id love to see what you could do to the stock planets to give them better texture.

only Moho, Eve, Kerbin, MÃƒÂ¼n and Duna got a texture pass in 0.21

Update 7-27-15

**Changes**

- New Contract Configurator contracts
- Kessler Run - Set a new record for Canyon flight!
- Rescue whole, working crafts! - Fly a spaceplane home from the surface of Asclepius!
- Find a derelict Mining vessel, and attempt salvage!
- Distant object enhancement support added
- Cleaned up messy code

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-03T20:33:50Z" title="08/03/2015 08:33  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 3, 2015</time> by MrChumley**

> 
> \*includes\* [Kopernicus v0.2](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114649), and [Module Manager v2.6.6](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55219) .dll's

I wish it wouldn't. While I just commented on disk space not being an issue in another thread, consider what if every mod includes every dependency in its download archive.

Also consider what if your mod depends on another mod that depends on a third mod, or what if one of your dependencies updates...

A list, or better yet a list of links to, the dependencies in the opening post, like you already have, should be sufficient.

Other than that, looking forward to some canyon flying ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

**EDIT:** Point in case: 

> 
> - Texture pass
> - Updated Kopernicus to 0.2.4
> - Bundled with: Contract Configurator, E.V.E. clouds, and Distant object enhancement. (licenses included)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> (D/L links in OP updated)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-05T19:21:12Z" title="08/05/2015 07:21  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 5, 2015</time> by Corax**

> 
> ...what if your mod depends on another mod that depends on a third mod, or what if one of your dependencies updates...

Hello Corax. Thanks for stopping by and providing some input. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I'll take that into consideration on my next update and make it just "bare bones".

edit

I updated **Github**. You can [Download the .zip](https://github.com/MrChumley/Asclepius/archive/master.zip) from there. It doesn't include any dependencies. And you are guaranteed the latest version ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I'm also working on a [wiki](https://github.com/MrChumley/Asclepius/wiki) over there too.

/edit

On the other hand, I might keep a link with "tested and working" dependencies included. It is a real time saver to have a "1 stop shop d/l". 

Happy Canyon flying! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> Why does it have Erin's normal map?

That texture is procedurally generated by VertexSimlexHeight (I think ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif) )

I didn't remove all the PQS mods from the Laythe Template and it is a relic from that.

The ground on Asclepius has looked like that for awhile... You just couldn't tell from space. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

The system will not work at all, even with The updated Kopernicus and Module Manager. In fact it breaks every other system I have loaded, such as OPM and Other\_Worlds, as in causing them not to load.

> 
> The system will not work at all, even with The updated Kopernicus and Module Manager. In fact it breaks every other system I have loaded, such as OPM and Other\_Worlds, as in causing them not to load.

![zayWmrb.gif](http://i.imgur.com/zayWmrb.gif)

This is a fresh install with just Asclepius v0.7 (Kerbalstuff D/L), and OPM.

The problem must be on your end. If you provide more details (which D/L did you use? log files?) it is more likely that you will receive support.

Your licenses on KerbalStuff are conflicting with each other.

**Your KS Licenses:**

The following information is copied from the '[License Selection Guide](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/44738)'.

**CC0**

This allows people to modify your work, sell it, or use it to develop nuclear weapons Ã¢â‚¬â€ all without giving you any credit!

**CC-SA**

This doesn't exist but CC-BY-SA does. This allows the public to copy and distribute your work and require that you be given credit.

Check '[Creative Commons Licenses](http://creativecommons.org/licenses/)' for more CC licenses.

**Lesser General Public License (LGPL)**

This is a software license, which your mod isn't. This allows people to use your software in conjunction with other software (by exposing an API or something similar).

I should go for a Creative Commons license, as it fits best for your planets.

EDIT: If you'll include other mods into your download, please add their license file into the download. You've done this for MM but not for Kopernicus.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-25T17:28:23Z" title="08/25/2015 05:28  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 25, 2015</time> by Olympic1**

> EDIT: If you'll include other mods into your download, please add their license file into the download. You've done this for MM but not for Kopernicus.

![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

The LGPL license is included for, and redistributed along with Kopernicus. (License.txt) ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

The CC-SA license is included for, and redistributed along with ModuleManager. (ModuleManagerLicense.md) ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Asclepius is released under CC0. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) (license for Asclepius is in AsclepiusInstallation.txt)

I'll put the LGPL license IN the Kopernicus folder for my next release... ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

My papers should be in order sir.

It shouldn't be too long... I have to update MM, and Kopernicus as well since they both just got an update.

\*edit\*- Also, I am in need of help converting the .png's in Asclepius to .dds format to save RAM. (thanks to Sigma88 for the help so far)
